alert.note: Alert for Western Kenai Peninsula; Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 17 at 5:20AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...ANOTHER ROUND OF MIXED RAIN AND SNOW LATE THIS MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... The active weather pattern will continue today with another storm system moving across Southcentral Alaska. Precipitation will overspread the Kenai Peninsula beginning late this morning. The precipitation is expected to begin as rain/snow mix for the northern half of the Kenai Peninsula, including the Sterling Highway north of Clam Gulch and the Seward Highway north of Kenai Lake. Any mix is expected to transition to all rain by late morning today as temperatures climb into the mid to upper 30s. The rain may mix with or change back over to snow by early Friday morning as the precipitation comes to an end. Up to 2 inches of snow are possible along the Sterling Highway north of Clam Gulch, with the 2 inch total most likely near Kenai where temperatures are starting the day in the upper 20s. Many areas may either see all rain or the snow will melt on contact with the ground. 1 to 5 inches of accumulation are possible through Turnagain Pass and Portage Valley, with the higher amounts through the Pass. Strong southeasterly wind gusts are also likely across Portage Valley and Turnagain Pass today. However, with temperatures around freezing, blowing snow is not expected to be a concern.

area.areaDesc: Western Kenai Peninsula; Western Prince William Sound
